title: Introduction to JavaScript
body: JavaScript is a versatile scripting language used for web development.

title: Understanding CSS Flexbox
body: Flexbox is a layout module that makes it easy to design flexible responsive layout structure.

title: Getting Started with React
body: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces.

title: What is TypeScript?
body: TypeScript extends JavaScript by adding types, making code easier to read and debug.

title: Using Git and GitHub
body: Git is a version control system; GitHub is a platform for hosting and collaborating on Git repositories.

title: Responsive Design Principles
body: Responsive design ensures your website looks good on all devices.

title: Node.js Basics
body: Node.js allows you to run JavaScript on the server side.

title: Deploying a Web App
body: There are many ways to deploy a web application, such as using Vercel, Netlify, or traditional VPS hosting.

title: Introduction to MongoDB
body: MongoDB is a NoSQL database that stores data in JSON-like documents.

title: Handling API Requests
body: APIs allow your application to communicate with other services or databases.
